-There were very few issues with mask wearing
-Student drop-off went great considering parents couldn‚Äôt enter the building
-Students understood the importance of washing their hands and social distancing
-Most of our new technology was up and running without an issue
-The building and classrooms were constantly getting cleaned/disinfected
-Teachers were taking time to get to know their students and reconnecting after not seeing them since March
-Our bus drivers and riders were very aware of the importance of staying healthy and safe on the bus
-The breakfast/lunch changes went very smoothly

These are several of the day‚Äôs high points, but there were also many others. It was so nice to see our staff and students happy to be back together and beginning what‚Äôs going to be an outstanding 2020-2021 school year!

post_text:
BCES Student Belongings Pickup:

Teachers have bagged up student belongings from lockers, desks, cubbies, and the classroom and those are in the elementary gym. We will have pickup for these belongings on Tuesday, June 2nd from 10:00 am to 6 pm. There is no rush or reason to line up get into the gym. Both sets of doors will be open for you to enter on the east side of the gym. The rest of the school will closed off to parents or students. Everything has been moved to the gym for this pickup.

The gym has been divided up into 7 sections marked by the grade. Bags are labeled with the student name. Inside the bag or stapled to the bag will be the report card. There will also be a summer educational packet.

If you have any materials that need to be turned in (textbooks, library books, etc) just put them on the floor within the grade level section. Mrs. Rayba will be collecting 5th and 6th grade band shirts. Please bring those and we will have a bin for those to be put in. We will also have a lost and found section for you to look through.
